Articles.Content:
The icon/button I am talking about is located in the upper right of the screen when in flight, and the bottom left of the screen when building. It resembles a wireless icon, and has a little 0 under it, and when moused over it says none.

Please help, I am deadly curious and have not been able to find an answer! Thanks!

You mean this icon?

If you complete a contract (or perform some other actions that give you messages), KSP puts a message to that effect under this button. It simply says "0" and "none" because there's no messages to display. Obviously, you need to be in a Career-mode game to get contracts.

For reference, the other three buttons from left to right are:

  1. Money/Reputation/Science counters
  2. Shipboard resource display
  3. Contract requirements listing

What other action gives you a message? Have I missed something from KSP? I thought it would only give you a message when you finished a contract.

Rescuing a Kerbal triggers a message to tell you they've joined your space program. That's tied in with contracts, mind.

In future, there could be other messages to alert the player in there.

It flashes green for a few seconds when a contract is completed. The number zero changes to reflect the number of completed contract. So, if you have completed 12 contracts, the number 12 would be displayed there.

What other action gives you a message? Have I missed something from KSP? I thought it would only give you a message when you finished a contract.

It will also display if you have completed a part of an "Explore" contract, or if you have a Debris Recovery mod those will also give a message. Kerbal Construction Time will also notify you of Vessel Completion.
